text: Charles-Émilien Thuriet (5 October 1832, Baume-les-Dames – 8 December 1920, Turin) was a 19th–20th-century French writer and poet. A magistrate by occupation, Thuriet was, with Charles Weiss, cofoundator of the Revue littéraire de la Franche-Comté. Thuriet was an associated member of the Académie de Besançon. == Publications == * Les procès s’en vont ! ou Essai sur les causes générales qui ont amené en France la diminution des procès civils,, Paris, Dumoulin, 1861. * Revue littéraire de la Franche-Comté, Besançon, Outhenin Chalandre fils, 1863-1868. * Traditions populaires de l’arrondissement de Poligny, Poligny, G.
